Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.server.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
RemoteGameController, Serializable, Remote
public class GameController extends UnicastRemoteObject implements RemoteGameController
the game controller ensures the communication through client controller and server model

  • Method Details

    • checkValidRetrieve

      public boolean checkValidRetrieve(String player, ArrayList<Coordinates> coords) throws RemoteException, PlayerNotInTurnException, GameNotStartedException, GameEndedException, EmptySlotException
      first method to call, it is used to confirm that a certain set of item tiles can be taken by the player in the board (but without actually taking it)
      Specified by:
      checkValidRetrieve in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - the player that perform the action
      coords - the list of coordinates where tiles should have been taken
      Returns:
      true, if the action is permitted
      Throws:
      RemoteException - RMI Exception
      PlayerNotInTurnException - this player is not the player in turn
      GameNotStartedException - the game has not started, yet
      GameEndedException - the game has already ended
      EmptySlotException - one of the coordinates refers to an empty slot

    • moveTiles

      public void moveTiles(String player, ArrayList<Coordinates> source, int column) throws RemoteException, GameNotStartedException, GameEndedException, NotEnoughSpaceException, PlayerNotInTurnException, EmptySlotException, InvalidCoordinatesException
      the second method to be called by the player, it performs the insertion of the tile in the bookshelf of the player, removing them from the board. it also checks if the livingroom should be refilled and, in that case invoke the refill action. If the player with this move completed his bookshelf we check if he is the first one to do so, if that happens the player gets the FIRSTPLAYER token. At the end of the method the turn passes to the next player
      Specified by:
      moveTiles in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - the player that is performing the action
      source - the coordinates to be taken
      column - the column where the coordinates will be inserted
      Throws:
      RemoteException - RMI Exception
      GameNotStartedException - the game has not started, yet
      GameEndedException - the game has already ended
      NotEnoughSpaceException - the column selected has no space for the selected tiles
      PlayerNotInTurnException - this player is not the player in turn
      EmptySlotException - one of the coordinates refers to an empty slot
      InvalidCoordinatesException - one of the coordinates is not valid

    • postBroadCastMessage

      public void postBroadCastMessage(String player, String message) throws RemoteException, InvalidPlayerException
      This method post a chat message to all the players
      Specified by:
      postBroadCastMessage in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - username of the player that sent the message
      message - content of the message
      Throws:
      RemoteException - RMI Exception
      InvalidPlayerException - the username of the sender is not valid

    • postDirectMessage

      public void postDirectMessage(String player, String receiver, String message) throws RemoteException, InvalidPlayerException, SenderEqualsRecipientException
      used to create a message to a certain player in the same game
      Specified by:
      postDirectMessage in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      player - the player that want to send the message
      receiver - the player that will receive the message
      message - the message to be sent
      Throws:
      RemoteException - RMI Exception
      InvalidPlayerException - if there isn't any player with that username inside the game
      SenderEqualsRecipientException - if the string player and receiver are the same

    • triggerAllListeners

      public void triggerAllListeners(String userToBeUpdated) throws RemoteException
      Method used to trigger all the listeners when a player joins or re-joins a game after a crash, to receive the complete status of the game such as players bookshelf's, points or livingRoomBoard
      Specified by:
      triggerAllListeners in interface RemoteGameController
      Parameters:
      userToBeUpdated - the username of the user that needs to receive the updates
      Throws:
      RemoteException - RMI Exception

    • getSelectedTiles

      public Set<Coordinates> getSelectedTiles()
      This method returns the set of the tiles selected
      Returns:
      a set that contains all the selected Tiles
